article.h1: Charge on beneficiary of a non-resident - administration

div.p: TCGA92/S87 applies if a beneficiary of a non-resident settlement receives a capital payment from the trustees of that settlement. It treats the beneficiary as receiving a proportion of the trustees’ gains, a process commonly called attributing the gains. Any gains attributable to the settlor under TCGA92/S86, CG38435, are not included in the trustees’ gains attributable to the beneficiaries under section 87.

Liability under section 87 is dealt with WMBC Assets Edinburgh at edinburgh.trustscompliance@hmrc.gov.uk Link: mailto:edinburgh.trustscompliance@hmrc.gov.uk HMRC Charities, Savings and International, Bootle and other specialist compliance offices. Please do not enter into any correspondence on these cases without contacting WMBC Assets Edinburgh at edinburgh.trustscompliance@hmrc.gov.uk Link: mailto:edinburgh.trustscompliance@hmrc.gov.uk HMRC Charities, Savings and International, Bootle . If technical advice is needed or litigation proceedings are possible refer to HMRC Capital Gains Technical.
